div1.head: Biography
div1.p: Harvey Bear lived near Churchville in Augusta County during the war. Along with his slaves and family members, Bear cultivated his land, practicing mixed agriculture and raising livestock for sale and consumption. In his diary, Bear chronicled his transactions nearby in his community and surrounding towns and further away in Richmond, sometimes for cash and sometimes for exchange. Shorter entries reveal Bear's involvement in agricultural organizations, religious activities, and local politics. Though Bear primarily described the work of a wealthy farmer and his laborers during the war, he also provided glimpses into the lives of his own family members and those of his friends and neighbors. Brief references to the war include the movement of troops, interactions with military officers, supplying the Confederate army, and the actions of the local militia.

div3.head: Jan 1st
div3.p: very windy Was in Staunton To Day hired Hardin to Col. Harman, day passed off quiet, no sales, very fiew men,

div3.head: (Jan 2)
div3.p: hiered Lyons [footnote: Later, Bear referred to Lyons as a "Man of Colour."] to chop, sent letter to J S Effinger Richmond concerning Plaster +c
pulled off corn two dry quit, hauled rails +c commenced sleeting in evening. wrote to Mr Lochridge concerning yoke steers,
still cloudy very dry Hauled 5 Loads wood to Churchville Very slippy + dangerous Hauling
Sunday Very cold rained + Snowed some at night
Chopping Wood Mr Sieg + Mr N H Hotchkiss rode over my farm to report to our Farmers Club next meeting

div3.head: Jan (7th)
div3.p: Cold + Cloudy

div3.head: (8th)
div3.p: F. Club met to day at Mr Trimbles day passed off fine

div3.head: (9th)
div3.p: carried Capt Hoovers sheep home, traded sheep with Saml Cochran

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: entered in bond with T. N. Lindsey as P M.

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Brought Jack from Mr Sieg's to my house commenced Plowing sent Mrs Fisher 9 1/2 lbs Pork rained at night

div3.head: Sunday (12)
div3.p: Stayed at home all day (Fannie sick)
Plowing Hill
stormy
Sent team to Forge for Iron for Mr. Eurett rained + sleeted best part of day.
Went to see about a school for Rebecca eat dinner at F Hoovers found his babe sick
prized up negro House drisling rain nearly all day repaired sill Mssrs. Dedrick + Hotchkiss helped,

div3.head: Sunday 19
div3.p: warm + cloudy went to church
Cloudy + warm some rain considerable Thunder + lightning
Cloudy + wet paid Mr. Thomas shoe at 5 80 bought 8 lb While lead 15c lb sent 106 Dollars to C H Bear to lift firm note still ow him $5.12
still cloudy + damp some snow,

sent a letter to Jacob Hanger concerning the purchase of a yoke of steers settled with Mr Hizer Recd pay for Horse. Recd side soleather, Recd, Recd order of Jas Wilson Esqr for necessarys furnished Mrs Fisher + Mrs Grady, Claimants to County fund for sent a letter to Mr. Effinger (Richmond) for 2 Tun more plaster

choped on clearing 1/2 day Mr. Hotchkiss came over + rived out a lot of Plow handles. Commenced Snowing about 12 O clock snowed very fast + still snowing when night came on. heard to day my plaster is shiped.

Hauled manure on wheat sowed plster on the manure after spread, sowed narrow strip plaster on Wheat from stak at edge of manure to the fence corner above cherry + two cedar trees ground covered with snow now

div3.head: Jan Sunday (26)
div3.p: Went to church,

went to Staunton Sidney went along left her, Deposited ninety five Dollars in bank (Valley) had Hotchkiss bill of sale recorded recd 21 Dollars 3 cts of county, paid one Dollar for recording bill of sale, received bill of Plaster +c of R W. Pierce +c Amt due him 56.18 Recd note of H. H. Teaford for Abram's board for this year to end with this year, 31st Decr 62
Returned Mr. Hizer 15 Fifteen Dollars (5 + 10) note for current, Howard Huston here on his way to Rockingham,

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Chopped clearing Jas Henry [footnote: James Henry was probably a younger relative of Harvey Bear. He appears as a member of the Bear household in the 1870 Census, but not the 1860 census.] Deposited 35 Dollars in bank, brought Sidney Home, very pretty day very war,

div3.head: (30th)
div3.p: Killed Beef, rained all day

div3.head: (31st)
div3.p: went to church Mr. Junken preached cut up beef in evening sent Mrs Fisher 47 +s also 3 1/2 lb Lard

div3.head: Feb (1st)
div3.p: went to church ground covered with snow this morning very sleppy riding received letter from Effinger containing recpt of check sent him 56.16 called on Mr. Jed Hotchkiss saw his maps +c.

div3.head: Sunday (2nd)
div3.p: Sacrament of Lords Supper administered at our church to day Mr Junken assisted all the time 4 persons admitted in our church by Examination Mr. J Preached in Churchville in evening

div3.head: Monday (3rd) Feb
div3.p: Snowing early in morning Hardin came home this morning. Rebecca went up to her school, called and settled with Jacob Hanger, paid him choped wood for Mrs. Fisher

div3.head: (4th)
div3.p: Thrashed off clover seed and covered apples in garden found them keeping pretty well, packed up 3 barrels to send to Richmond, Recd letter from Jacob Hanger, Jas Henry Started to school Salted beef 4th [footnote: This last line appears as a notation in the margin of the page.]

div3.head: (5th)
div3.p: was going to butcher to day but rain prevented rained nearly all day, cleaned clover seed 2 3/4 bus filled 4 bags with B Flour 5 to each left empty barrel at mill Mr H. Harris came + stayed all night

div3.head: (6th)
div3.p: helped dig grave for Mr. Snelling's Daughter Buried in evening, Miss Kate + Angie + Miss Teaford paid us a visit

div3.head: (7th)
div3.p: put up new style + hitching rack Recd letter from Mr Burk concerning Plaster, Dr. Wilson paid me for 4 Tun Plaster $64.20, Jas Henry went to see Rebecca

div3.head: (Sunday 9)
div3.p: was at church thin congregation

div3.head: (10th)
div3.p: Sent Wagon to Staunton, for Plaster sent 3 barrels apples + 6 Bags B Flour to R to Taylor + Son, Deposited 101 Dollars in bank

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Killed 6 Hogs weighing 1007 lbs average weight 168 lbs

div3.head: Feb 12th
div3.p: Salted pork lightly, spread on floor put beef stake in pickle sent Biby 2 loads wood. sent Mrs Fisher 18 lbs chine [footnote: a cut of meat] +c

div3.head: (13th)
div3.p: F Club met at Mr. Sieg's, was thier, sent Dennis to Staunton for plaster, also sent 1 load wood which he left on road, road very bad could not haulit,

div3.head: 14th
div3.p: Recd order from Jas Wilson to Furnish Mrs Grady 1.25 cts worth of provisions for Week it being her allowance from county fund. furnished her 5 1/2 lbs Bacon, plowing to day commenced Pruning orchard, Furnished Mrs Fisher 3 1/2 lbs Lard,

div3.head: (15th)
div3.p: Snowing early in morning Dennis plowing + turned down 3 in. snow, Salted pork

div3.head: Sunday 16th Feb
div3.p: was at Church very bad riding met + appointed delegate to got to Presbyty at Staunton on 20th
Rained moderately all day Recd letter from Jacob Hanger concerning yoke steers,

div3.head: (18th)
div3.p: Hauled wood to Chruchville 2 Loads Mr. Euritt 1 Mrs Fisher 1 Mr. Thomas Thomas paid 1 Dollar Settled with Mr. Lindsey he fell in my Debt 14.16 sent $14.16 with him to Richmond to buy Cotton yarn, warm + Clear,
rained all day Andrew Ervine stayed until evening hauled Mr. Lindsey some straw brought it up from shop sleeted,

div3.head: (20th)
div3.p: went to Staunton Presbytary met + Recd Mr. Saml Brown's resignation + declared the Falling Spring church vacant. settled with Mosley + Taylor fell in their debt 5.63 paid, Came by Mr. Hoover's + Found him quite sick, River quite high, Plowed Mr. Hotchkiss + Mr. Dedrick Called both Stayed until after Dinner, Settled with Mr. Dedrick fell in his debt 4.30 credited the same in my book, let him have 14 1/2 lbs Bacon
Choped + Hauled wood with 2 horseteam, Plowed Hauled Mr. Euritt 1 Load Rained all night,

div3.head: (23) Sunday
div3.p: Went to church at Churchville Mr. Arnold Preached at Funeral for Mr. Stephen Myers Children which had been buried some time before,

very pretty bright morning, commenced storming about nine oclock rained some wind blew very hard the balance of the day, blew over one of my Hay stacks, also a considerable amount of fence settled with B. H. Lickliter fell in his debt 1.82 paid him, Sent to Staunton fer 5 lbs Nails paid 15 ¢ pr lbs. bought new Boots from Shoemaker for self + Hardin
went to saw mill brought home 222 Ft plank bt.- of Mr. Koontz am to pay him 2.25, worked cault did very well, fixt up hay stack, making boxes fer hens to lay in, had 1 shoe put on horse
very pretty morning, put up fence, Brined my Pork, Plowing, rained after Dinner,
Choped Wood + Haled 4 Loads to Mr. Biby, 1 To Mr. Dedrick, 1 to Rev Arnold, Mr. Thomas took measures to make slippers, Dr. Wilson Borrowed Horse To go to Staunton,
went to church, this day was set apart by the President for humiliation + Prayer, very windy + cold,

div3.head: (March 1st)
div3.p: cut corn stalks, finished pulling corn had 2, 2 horse Loads hauled it in barn, Hauled some fodder in stable mow, ground frozen clouded up a while after dark Took slipper patterns to Mr Thomas to make Fannie Recd letter from Harrisonburg informing her that Bettie Effinger was Very sick, went to prayer meeting at night, furnished Mrs. Grady 27 1/2 lbs Flour furnished Lyons (Man of Colour) 14 lbs flour for one days chopping,

div3.head: (Sunday) morning
div3.p: slight of snow, commenced rainging about 9 Oclock, started to Harrisonburg with Fannie + Frank about 10 Oclock, found the road very bad commenced sleeting + snowing about 12 Oclock considerable Thunder + lightning between 12 + 1 Oclock, (something very unusual) we stoped at Mrs. Neffs + warmed + dride our selves ceaced raining we got along withe the exception of the road being Very bad arrived at H'Brg about 6 Oclock, was informed Bettie E. something better, stayed all night with Mr. Bell

next morning (3) called to see Bettie, started home with Frank between 9 + 10, commenced raining about 12 rained very fast stoped at Mrs. Neff's horses fed + dinner, arrived at home some time after dark nearly 8 Oclock,
Trees all covered with Ice, ground slightly frozen, Hauled corn to crib Hauled Mr. Thomas 1 Load wood Hauled in small stack Hay, Capt. Huff paid Mrs Grady's at (4 of 3.60)
T. N. Lindsey paid his at of 14.16. had George's Cault shod behind very hard to shoe, Trimed apple trees after Dinner, bought 4/4 Angus of Mr. Lindsey,
Huling Wood in fore part of the day Plowing after Dinner wrote letter to Col Baldwin Preserving Currents + berry's
Hauled Fodder 1/2 day hauled rock after Dinner went to funeral of Koontz's + Biby's children Recd letter from Fannie Bettie is better

div3.head: Sunday (9)
div3.p: went to church in morning in evening went to funeral of Helem's child,
raining in morning Dinner Plowing, pruning Trees, removed Turnips to seller,

sent 36 Dz egges 18 1/2 lbs Butter 2 1/2 bus Turnips 1/2 bus Beets to Staunton, lent Mrs Lindsey horse to go to her brothers, sent letter to Fannie enclosed $10 to her recd pay for Eggs +c 20s for Eggs 35s for Butter 50s for turnips + came that the Malitia must report themselves in Staunton on Friaday next with two days rations to march immediately to Winchester
Sowed clover seed on rye in newground, received answer to letter from Col Baldwin,

this is the day our of our regular Club meeting, but postponed until next Wednesday, by request of Mr. Greding at whose house we meet, Election day for or against nullifying the constitution to kept open 3 days very votes polled to day I acting as one of the commissioners, sowed plaster on rye + grass in new field in the morning commenced raining about 10 Oclock came thunder, rained nearly all day bought first reader for Frank found sow with a litter of 10 pigs, (in woods,) hope they may do well, this evening at candle lighting was appointed for prayer meeting, none attended owing to the excitement, sorry for it,
Plowing, the Malitia order to report in Staunton, they returned in evening to report next morning, I attended the election all the time to day,

went to Staunton for Fannie we returned in evening, rained nearly all day, the Malitia ordered to report Monday, some men from our neighborhood disgraced them selves + familys by running to the mountain, to avoid being drafted,

div3.head: Sunday 16th
div3.p: went to church small congregation.

The 160 regiment of Malitia started for Strasburg where they have to report to Genl Jackson, Mr. Dinkles little Maggie Died poor child had to suffer immense sick some 20 days, she is to be buried to morrow 11 Oclock,
helped dig grave, very pretty day,
Farmer Club met at Mr. Gredings, 7 members present, next meeting to be at Dr. Wilsons planted Peas in evening, commenced raining,
went to Mr. Shueys sale bought Old side saddle, roads very bad, rained lightly all day in evening rained harder at night quite hard

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Snowing in morning

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: brought carriage body from saw mill
ground paint +c
Sunday was at church no preaching, Prayer Meeting
went to Staunton saw Mr Seig getting better, very cold, heard Federal troops left Winchester Gen. Jackson following them up,
ground paint for carriage heard this evening Jackson had a battle five miles this side of Winchester on last Sunday heard he was repulsed with considerable loss, not know how many the Federals lost,
settled with Mr. Hensel, Mr. Ervine called to day on his way to Mr. Crawford, did some spading in garden,
Painted carriage, worked in garden +c
Sowed clover seed + chopped on field above barn,
Sowed plaster on wheat above barn + on wheat + grass in second field above orchard rained in evening froze on trees +c
Sunday went to Church at Churchville
Sowed 3 bus Barley in Corn stalks field sowed the balance in Oats 14 bus plowed it in with double shovels without plowin with

div3.head: April 2
div3.p: planted a row potatoes in garden 1 row peas,

div3.head: Apl 3
div3.p: Planted Garden planted potatoes in patch behind Dry house,

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: painted carriage
Rained Hauled 1 Load to Everitt,

div3.head: 6 Sunday
div3.p: went to church,

div3.head: Monday 4th,
div3.p: painted Carriage, Sowed plaster in field next to newground went to Staunton, snowed + sleeted all the evening
rained sleeted + snowed both days made brooms, as many as 12

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Farmers Club met at Dr. Wilsons, had a very pleasant time, Hauled wood 1 Load to Rev. Arnold 1 to Everitt 1 to Thomas, call to see Mr. Sellers in evening

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Hauled Wood 1 Load to Mr. Helms paid 1 2 to Mr Biby 1 to Rev. Arnold pruned Trees in Orchard trimed George's Hair, made several chicken coops +c Have a young Calf
Hauled Leaves in barn yard Home company met at churchville + organized they are to meet next Saturday 3 Ocloc,

div3.head: Sunday 13th
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 14th
div3.p: Sowed Oats it was too wet quite sowed clover seed where I sowed oats, harrowed corn after dinner, still cloudy + has been nearly every day since the 5th)

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Raining, brought 6 Barrels flour from Mill put it in smoke House Hauled C. 1 Load wood

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: Presbytery met at Union church Rev. Mr. Junkin preached the opening
was over every day adjourned to day very pleasant meeting

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Dr McFarland preached rained very hard army
Sunday Sacrament very rainy very few persons at church Great Excitement caused by a move ment in the Army excitement on yesterday still continues rained all day

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Rained all day + at night last night water high excitement not abated Genl Johnson passed through Churchville to day on his way to his army at West View took Dinner with Mr. Lindsey Mr. Emmerson at my house Mr. Price left this morning

div3.head: 22nd
div3.p: went part the way with Rebecca on her way to her school, stoped at the camp near west View found the soldiers in fine Spirits

Great excitement concerning the move ment of the enemy some of their scouts in Jennings Gap took Wm Hite prisoner with two others. Nomber of our cavalry in churchville scouting the roads we expect the enemy in here Howard Hudson here

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Sent 10 pieces Bacon to Mr. Lindseys 9 hams 1 Sholder, sent Mr. Dedrick 113 lbs Bacon sent Barrels To J Hanger

div3.head: April 25
div3.p: Sent Capt Hottle horse to aide to Mt Solon J. B. Sellers rode bay horse Fan To Rockbridge to have her out of the way of the Federals if they come in he is to sell her if not return her,

div3.head: 26th
div3.p: brought brand + some Flour from J. H. excitement still prevailing not knowing what the move ment of our army will be, the evacuation of the Valley seem evident, sold 76 lbs Bacon to Camp at Churchville

div3.head: Sunday 27t
div3.p: went to church but few numbers, Bishop Glossbrenner preached at churchville in evening large assembly sent 100 lbs Bacon to camp at Churchville Clar weather
Heard to day the Federals leaving the grass gone across Shannandoah Mountain Harrowed in corn ground Capt Hottle returned with horse sent G M. with him to coamp still clear
Sowed Oats cloudy rained some in morning, Shearing sheep, sent 10 bus Oats to Camp Churchville Rockbridge Cavalry

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: 31 1/2 bus Oats by Mr. Myers, sowing Oats, washed Wool, Planted peas + Beans 30 bus Oats to Rockbridge Cavalry Cloudy some rain,

div3.head: May 1st
div3.p: Cloudy + Drizling rain rained all night, 30 bus Oats Rockbridge Cavalry 70 1/2 lbs Bacon R. C, sowed clover seed

div3.head: 2nd
div3.p: Clear this morning, shower rain at 2 Oclock, lent Andrew Ervine horse to go home to be back tomorrow Mare Souce Has a colt this morning boys repairing fence, pruned apple trees, sent Jas Henry to Staunton with a check from Mssers Hotchkiss to pay note in Col Baylors hands Baylor did not receive it 20 1/2 bus Oats to R Cavalry 6 to Churchville Do Daved Bear Hopkins + Whitner stayed all night, with us,

div3.head: 3rd
div3.p: Harrowing corn ground very pretty day, 29 bus Oats R. C. 60 lbs Bacon C. C. A Ervine returned with horse, Lieutenant Hanger Q. M. paid me $35 75-

div3.head: Sunday 4th
div3.p: went to church at Churchville Rev Mr. Arnold preached. Rev. Mr. Walker preached in evening

div3.head: 5th
div3.p: Commenced planting corn, sold 15 lbs Bacon ham to Capt Mc sold 71 lbs Bacon to R. C. 22 lbs to C. C. heard to day Gen Jackson bringing reinforcemtns to Staunton Federals at McDowal some this side Shannandoah Mountain expect an attack in a few days

div3.head: 6th
div3.p: Sold 41 lbs Bacon to Charlotte Cavalry, 61 lbs D to Churchville Ca finished planting in far field

div3.head: 7th
div3.p: Harrowing for corn helped J. H. B Sellers to plant corn Col. Johnson passing with his army through the Mountain,

div3.head: 8th
div3.p: Planting corn very pretty weather, heard cannon from 12 to about 3 Oclock supposed to be the federals on Bull pasture Mountain,

div3.head: 9th
div3.p: finished planting corn in chesnut tree field

div3.head: 10th
div3.p: Dennis + the boys helped C. B to plant corn, finished plowing in orchard, rode to Dr Wilsons

div3.head: Sunday 11t
div3.p: went to church at Churchville Rev Mr. Davis preached, Bishop Glossbrenner preached in evening

div3.head: 12t\
div3.p: Sowed Oats in Orchard + Sowed orchard Grass + Clover after dinner commenced plowin in Mr. Hotchkiss's field,

div3.head: 13th
div3.p: Raining set out plants +ce.

div3.head: 15th
div3.p: Farmers Club met at Mr. Hotchkiss had a good time, Cavalry left Churchville, Genl Jacksons army came on this side of S. Mountain, raining nearly all day,

div3.head: 16th
div3.p: Went to church very few persons their wagons across the river to day in evening visited Army in Jennings Gap, returned home at dark found a lot of soldiers at my house for the night,

div3.head: 17th
div3.p: Rained all day Hauled 2 Loads Wood to Mr. Biby commenced plowing in orchard, helped Mr Hotchkiss to scrape manure, took Mare Huldy to Dr Wilsons, 3 soldiers here for the night with 2 Ambulances, Sidney + Jas H went to Mr. Trimbles, cloudy + warm Gen. Jacksons + Johnson's army near S. Springs,

div3.head: 18th Sunday
div3.p: went to church Churchville, Sacrament administered, Methodist,

div3.head: 19th
div3.p: Plowing at Mr. Hotchkiss, Plowing in Orchard at home, had Mare Fran to Jack,

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: finished Plowing Orchard Marked calves, +c,

div3.head: 21st
div3.p: Planted corn in orchard some sugar Cane,

div3.head: 22n
div3.p: Election for Sheriff Commissioners of revenue +c, very few votes,

div3.head: 23rd
div3.p: corn ground at Hotch

div3.head: 24th
div3.p: Planted corn rained slightly all day,

div3.head: Sunday 25t
div3.p: went to church at Churchville

div3.head: 26t
div3.p: took my Cattle to Mountain (7 head) Harden Plowing Corn

div3.head: 27th
div3.p: Planting potatoes in Orchard, received 147.75/100 Dollars of G. A. Hanger Q. M. have on hand 340$

div3.head: 28th
div3.p: went to Staunton lent Dr Wilson 2 horses + driver to haul a load of lumber to Staunton, helped Mr. Hotchkiss to haul Manure with 2 hands + one two horse wagon

div3.head: 29th
div3.p: Went round to hire teams to start to Winchester to morrow for stores taken by our army from enemy succeeded very well fixed up my team with Capt Sterretts.

div3.head: 30th
div3.p: Going with teams have charge of them have 80$n have 7.50$ for Mr. E. (Teams went by Staunton) Started to Harrisonburg by way of took Frank with me, stoped at mr. Ferry's out of a storm hailed considerable, arrived in Harrisonburg in evening but my horse at tavern stayed with mr. Bell,

div3.head: 31st
div3.p: Teams arrived here about 12 Oclock, paid Mr. Effinger $7.50 stayed all night with A. B. about 3 miles from town,

div3.head: Sunday June 1st
div3.p: Started to over take teames, teames ordered back when they were a short distance below Mt Jackson, owing to the advance of the enemy,

div3.head: (2nd)
div3.p: passed through HB. loaded my teams with hauling from Rockingham teams, traveled up + crossed the South river, stayed all night on on the back of River rained during night very hard,

div3.head: 3rd
div3.p: River fast fording, delivered our Loads at Staunton all safe, arrived home in evening

div3.head: Wednesday 4th
div3.p: rained all last night waters very high rained all day

div3.head: Thursday 5th
div3.p: Wading Oats thining corn was sick all day,

div3.head: Friday 6th
div3.p: Wm A shipped with us on his way home from army sick looking very badly went home with him in evening, stayed all night Fannie + Frank was along, left the boys to plant potatoes +c

div3.head: Saturday 7th
div3.p: went to Mountain to Salt Cattle failed to find them, returned home in the evening very tired found Mr. Boyd + Mr. Whitmere at my house, traveling out of the way of enemy,

div3.head: Sunday 8th
div3.p: went to Churchville to church Bishop Glosbrenner preached

div3.head: Monday 9th
div3.p: heard cannonading from 7 Oclock until about 9 in the direction of Port republic, Mr. Byod + Whitmere started up the valley Plowing corn very cool in morning, commenced raining about 3 Oclock, rained until night,

div3.head: Tuesday 10th
div3.p: raining sold steer to government sent him in Mr. Siegs lot he to receive pay for him weigh 966 lbs helped to lot of cattle beyond Staunton very little news to day concerning army Genl Jackson repulsed the enemy on yesterday with considerable loss to enemy has now in Browns Gap awaiting reinforcements, considerable of his men wounded

div3.head: Wednesday 11th
div3.p: thining corn, set out potatoe slips,

div3.head: Thursday 12th
div3.p: F Clubs met at Chapt Sandersons, very pleasant time adjourned to meet 2nd Thursday in August at Jas Wilsons Esq, quite clear + warm good day for wheat + corn, wheat threatened with rust, paid to F Club Ten Dollar for Mule ,

div3.head: Friday 13th
div3.p: Sent by Jas F. Bell $129.50 to pay to J. B. Trimble, for Lindsey Wilson + Bear recd of Bell $28 for sheep replanted corn in Orchard

div3.head: Saturday 14th
div3.p: Plowed corn Jas Henry Plowing for C Bear

div3.head: Sunday 15
div3.p: Went to church Churchville,

div3.head: Monday 16th
div3.p: finished Plowin one corn at home went to field at Mr. Hotchkiss after dinner, very cool weather feels like frost,

div3.head: Tuesday 17
div3.p: still cool finished plowing at Mr. Hotchkiss, plowed Mr. Biby's lot

div3.head: (Wednesday 18)
div3.p: planted potatoes in peach Orchard Hauled Wood Plowed Mr. Arnolds lot + Mr Lechtilers, Mr. Nicholas Rhyon paid me 25 Dollars for Bacon got one years age

div3.head: (Thursday 19th)
div3.p: commenced plowing back of orchard for Buck Wheat, plowing + bowing corn, one hand mowing clover

div3.head: (Friday 20th)
div3.p: plowing + hoeing corn all hands, Uncle Andrew us a visit

div3.head: Saturday 21th
div3.p: finished hoeing the upper field corn boy brought in lot of hay + went Fishing after dinner

div3.head: Sunday 22st
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 23nd
div3.p: howeing corn in chesnut tree field

div3.head: (Tuesday) 24rd
div3.p: went to mountain to salt cattle only found two,

div3.head: Wednesday 25
div3.p: working in corn boys mowing

div3.head: (Thursday) 26th
div3.p: working in corn

div3.head: (Friday) 27
div3.p: making + hauling hay

div3.head: Saturday 28th
div3.p: Sent Mr. Tates note by Jas Henry for collection he left it with Jas F Bell.

div3.head: Sunday 29th
div3.p: went to church at churchville

div3.head: Monday 30
div3.p: Plowing at Mr Hotchkiss for Buck Wheat made hay +c.

div3.head: Tuesday July 1
div3.p: Jas H + Hardin helped Mr Hotchkiss to harvest finished plowing sowed B wheat plowed in

div3.head: Wednesday 2nd
div3.p: rained all day

div3.head: Thursday 3rd
div3.p: Jas H + Dennis helped Mr H. to harvest finished sowing B Wheat in bottom sawed 5 bus Harvested some at home

div3.head: Friday 4
div3.p: Jas H + Dennis cutting wheat Harden Plowing back of orchard woed B. Wheat 2 bus + 1 bus Rye harrowed it twice G. M. went for Rebecca this evening, Cherry ripe

div3.head: Saturday 5th
div3.p: Cutting Wheat three hands from Mr. Hotchkiss

div3.head: Sunday 6th
div3.p: pd 50 in collection

div3.head: Monday 7th
div3.p: cutting Wheat 3 hands from Mr. Hotchkiss

div3.head: Tuesday 8th
div3.p: sent Jas Henry George + Hardin to Mr. Hotchkiss

div3.head: Wednesday 9t
div3.p: sent Jas Henry to Mr. Hotchkiss still cutting at home Wheat dead ripe

div3.head: Thursday 10th
div3.p: Finished cutting grain by 5 Oclock, went to C B + cut after supper

div3.head: Friday 11t
div3.p: rainin in the morning finished cutting C. B. grain after Dinner

div3.head: Saturday 12
div3.p: Dennis + Hardin harvesting for themselves Cleaned Garden + sugar cane Jas Henry harvested at Mr. Sterretts after dinner

div3.head: Sunday 13
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 14t
div3.p: hoed pottatoes +c Jas Henry + Dennis plowing corn

div3.head: Tuesday 15t
div3.p: Plowing Corn +c finished hoeing Potatoes + Beans rain in evening

div3.head: Wednesday 16
div3.p: Hauling in Wheat hauled 102 Dz out of field at barn, Shower of rain in evening Jas F. Bell here for hands to Harvest, Wm Sellers + Mr Wood here on a Visit, rained nearly all night was 7 Days cutting grain

div3.head: Thursday 17th
div3.p: Sent Jas Henry George Dennis + Hardin to help Jas F. Bell harvest very warm in morning rained about 1 Oclock continued all evening very gentle rain rited up my Wheat stacks in morning

div3.head: Friday 18th
div3.p: Rained all day Mended Bridles +c

div3.head: Saturday 19t
div3.p: put brush to cucumber Vines, set out some sweet potatoe slips sold Dr Cosin 14 lbs Bacon 1/6

div3.head: Sunday 20t
div3.p: went to church Rained about 2 Oclock

div3.head: Monday 21st
div3.p: Hauling in Wheat with two 2 horse teams Rebecca gave me 5$ on deposit

div3.head: Tuesday 22
div3.p: Hauling in Grain Finished Hauling Wheat

div3.head: Wednesday 23rd
div3.p: Plowin corn mowing +c brought Mr Bells mower down

div3.head: Thursday 24th
div3.p: Mowing with mower, cut C B. Oats

div3.head: Friday 25
div3.p: finished mowing in with mower put up hay +c Hauled C B. Oats

div3.head: Saturday 26
div3.p: rained last night put up hay in meadow sent Mr. Hotchkiss 43 lbs Bacon, plowed Corn fine morning rained a shower about sundown

div3.head: Sunday 27th
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 28th
div3.p: Stacked Hay in meadow

div3.head: Tuesday 29t
div3.p: stacked Hay in field commenced cutting Oats

div3.head: Wednesday 30th
div3.p: rained slower in morning plowed + hoed potatoes Hauled Oats in evening

div3.head: Thursday 31st
div3.p: Cloudy all day hauled in some Oats + hay finished cutting Oats in back field, commenced mowing in meadow at barn exchanged horses with Mr. Sickliter he wanting a gentle one to work in buggy

div3.head:
August 1st
Friday
div3.p: Hauling Oats

div3.head: Saturday 2d
div3.p: finished mowing meadow below barn put up the hay in evening finished hauling Oats open field cut oats in Orchard

div3.head: Sunday 3rd
div3.p: went to Church preaching in evening by Mr. Walker in Churchville

div3.head: Monday 4t
div3.p: Stacked Hay in meadow commenced mowing in back field

div3.head: Tuesday 5th
div3.p: Hauled in Oats out of Orchard finished cutting hay in back field + put it all up cutting Timothy seed, sowed Turnip seed, helped C B put up hay in evening Recd Twelve Dollars of Mr. Harauf by the hands of C. B. J D Imbodens company of artillery camped at Mrs Siegs to night

div3.head: Wednesday 6th
div3.p: Stacked hay hauled in grass seed rained at 2 Oclock dug potatoes in garden sowed turnip seed, J Henry helped Jas F Bell to mow +c

div3.head: Thursday 7th
div3.p: stacked hay for C. B. measured up 6 Bus potatoes to take to Staunton to morrow borrowed Mr. Lindseys wagon

div3.head: Friday 8th
div3.p: went to Staunton Sidney along, sold potatoes at 352 per Bus Bacon 35c Recd for Bacon potatoes +c 39.50 paid 12 Dollar to Dr Chapman for Dentist Work done for Sidney

div3.head: Saturday 9t
div3.p: Went to Mountain to salt Cattle brought steer home, Sowed turnip seed in newground,

div3.head: Sunday 10t
div3.p: Went to church at Churchville

div3.head: Monday 11th
div3.p: Hauling manure

div3.head: Tuesday 12th
div3.p: Went to Rockingham

div3.head: Wednesday 13th
div3.p: returned home Jas H George + Dennis helped Mr Hotchkiss to thrash after noon

div3.head: Thursday 14th
div3.p: Club met at Esqr Wilsons we adjourned to meet at Mr. Dudleys on the 2nd Thursday Sept, Recd of H. B. Sieg 57.86 for steer sold to Confederacy, pd Mr. Sieg 1.75 for work done last summer, Jas H. + George helping Mr Hotchkiss to thrash

div3.head: Friday 15t
div3.p: Still Hauling manure went to church at churchville Mr. H finished thrashing this morning about 9 Oclock

div3.head: Saturday 16th
div3.p: Went to church Churchville, Lutherans have a conference meeting

div3.head: Sunday 17th
div3.p: went to Church churchville - sacrament administer in Lutheran Church

div3.head: Monday 18th
div3.p: Thrashed Oats

div3.head: Tuesday 19th
div3.p: Thrashed Timothy seed +c paid Jas F Bell for Jas B Trimbles note against Lindsey Wilson + Bear 94.30 out of my own funds,

div3.head: Wednesday 20th
div3.p: boys went to Mountain for Whortleburg, pained Carriage +c

div3.head: Thursday 21st
div3.p: boys returned about noon got very fiew berrys two late nearly all gone, finished painting carriage,

div3.head: Friday 22nd
div3.p: Started to Harrisonburg had Frank along arrived their at 11 Oclock started back in evening put up for the night at Mr Coffmans, Hauled Mrs 1 Load Wood

div3.head: Saturday 23
div3.p: Started home arrived about 1 Oclock, sent Capt Polmer 8 shoals at 10 lbs

div3.head: Sunday 24t
div3.p: went to Church

div3.head: Monday 25
div3.p: Wheat Thrashing Mr. Hotchkiss sent 2 hands + mules sent Capt Polmer 7 more shoals all weighed 675 lbs at 10s $67.50 recd pay for them, Mr. Ewen Siblings was burned to day

div3.head: Tuesday 26
div3.p: put seed wheat in granery 90 bus, commenced thrashing for C. B.

div3.head: Wednesday 27th
div3.p: finished thrashing C. B. Wheat 50 bus by noon or little after

div3.head: Thursday 28th
div3.p: still thrashing Mr. Hotchkiss 2 hands helping

div3.head: Friday 29th
div3.p: finished thrashing at noon

div3.head: Saturday 30th
div3.p:
Put Wheat to Mill 25 bus to J. Hanger's, 143 to
6 bus small wheat
20 " Tailings
Jas Henry helped J B to thrash

div3.head: Sunday 31st
div3.p: went to church churchville no preaching

div3.head:
September
Monday 1st
div3.p: Varnished carriage Mr. Walker here.

div3.head: Tuesday 2nd
div3.p: Went to Staunton pd Chapman $7.50 for fixing Rebecca's teeth pd $1.25 for Stone pitcher commenced seeding in corn

div3.head: Wednesday 3rd
div3.p: started to Presbytery, which met at Providence church went as far as Capt Goliday's

div3.head: Thursday 4th
div3.p: Went to the church it was opened at 11 'Oclock stayed all night with Mr. Withers

div3.head: Friday 5th
div3.p: stayed all night with Mr. Hustens

div3.head: Saturday 6th
div3.p: I adjourned about 2 Oclock to meet at Tinkling Spring on second Wednesday in April next, had a verry pleasant meeting went back to Mr. Hustons

div3.head: Sunday 7th
div3.p: sacrament administered very large audience, held a collection raised 296$. went to Capt Martin's in evening for night

div3.head: Monday 8th
div3.p: started for home, had a very pleasant night, found the day very warm met with rm. J Trimble he paid me 10$ for Rebecca arrived at home about 1 Oclock

div3.head: Thursday 11th
div3.p: in corn cutting clover seed +c

div3.head: Friday 12th
div3.p: Went to funeral of J Hangers little girl, she died yesterday morning Rev Mr. Arnold preached

div3.head: Saturday 13th
div3.p: Finished repairing carriage +c

div3.head: Sunday 14th
div3.p: Went to church in carriage Rev Mr. Harris preached.

div3.head: Monday 15
div3.p: took Rebecca and Jas Henry to Brownsburg to school paid Mr. Trimble 120$. boys cutting corn.

div3.head: Tuesday 16th
div3.p: Returned home

div3.head: Wednesday 17th Sept
div3.p: Made fire in dry house to dry fruit somewhat cloudy, no rain

div3.head: Thursday 18t
div3.p: went to church thanksgiving day

div3.head: Friday 19th
div3.p: cutting corn Cleaned out ditch in meadow Killed shoat weighed 50 lbs

div3.head: Saturday 20
div3.p: working at corn + plowing over corn ground

div3.head: Sunday
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 21st
div3.p: Cutting corn plowin in cornground went to Staunton

div3.head: Tuesday 22
div3.p: Working at corn +c

div3.head: Wednesday 24rd
div3.p: Rained a little this morning not enough to wet ground, cut timber for hog per pen. Mr. Dedrick helped after dinner

div3.head: Thursday 25th
div3.p: Mr. Dedrick hewing timber or lumber for hog pen plowing over corn ground in newfield that has been sowed 10 Days ago

div3.head: Friday 26th Sept
div3.p: Working at hog pen

div3.head: Saturday 27th
div3.p: put up Frame for hog pen Mr. Dedrick quit this evening he helped 3 1/2 days at $1.50 per day opened Barrel flour

div3.head: Sunday 28th
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 29th
div3.p: Cutting B Wheat +c

div3.head: Tuesday 30th
div3.p: Riving out clabboards Mr. Dedrick helping, Hauling logs to mill

div3.head: Oct 1st Wednesday
div3.p: paid C B ten dollars for Rev Walker Hauling saw timber to mill Mr. Hotchkiss sawing Henry home for Dinner he went with me to see steer Which I wish to buy of J H. B. Sellers, offered him thirty five Dollars for them

div3.head: Thursday 2nd
div3.p: went to Staunton to attend Synod, I found a verry good attendance for the times. Sermon by Rev. Mackelwain very good Mr. W. Made a sheet in the evening concerning chaplancy

div3.head: Friday 3rd Oct
div3.p: Fannie + Sidney accompanied me to synod to day, Rev. Mr. Boman preached Mr. Bancock had an address concerning chaplancy to army, feeling

div3.head: Saturday 4th
div3.p: worked at hog pen +c

div3.head: Sunday 5t
div3.p: went to preaching Rev Mr. Barr preached, he also preached in Churchville in evening

div3.head: Monday 6th
div3.p: Worked at hog pen my self

div3.head: Tuesday 7th
div3.p: Mr. Dedrick here at work

div3.head: Wednesday 8th
div3.p: Thrashed Buck Wheat +c

div3.head: Thursday 9t
div3.p: finished B. wheat had a very small turn out only 20 bus in all went to club meeting at Mr. Dudleys, adjounred to meet at Mr. Rondabes the 2n Thursday in Oct.

div3.head: Friday 10th
div3.p: Went to see Mr Hite about going for salt

div3.head: Saturday 11t
div3.p: Went to Staunton for sumons in Siegs case finished hog pen to day Mr Dedrick Worked at it in all 9 Days at per day put hogs in it in evening, Went up to Mr. Lasleys to see about sending Dennis with him for salt he agreed to take charge of him, he consented to do so, I pd him Sixty Dollars to perchase salt +c

div3.head: Sunday 12th
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 13
div3.p: Started 2 horse team for salt Capt Sterrett put in one horse, Dennis driving borrow 5 hogs of Mr Gardner for Sterrett Sterrett put in 5 hogs feed I put in six + five empty bags, Came by Jas H Bear's pd him $403.45 noted executed to him by Lendry Wilson + Bear firm Money 32$ the bal my own Money $371.75 Which I have charged in my day book, paid postage to Lindsey on Register, Whig 1 quarter, or childs

div3.head: Tuesday 14th
div3.p: Gathering corn at Mr. Hotchkiss. Rev Mr Morten from Loundon Co here

div3.head: Wednesday 15th
div3.p: finished gathering corn at H very bad turn out not more than three or four bus pr acre Mr. Martin left here this morning about 5 Oclock for Richmond

div3.head: Thursday 16th
div3.p: Sowed rye for J. H. B. Sellers finished gathering fodder at Hotchkiss

div3.head: Friday 17th Oct
div3.p: Went to Shoemakers (Wheeler's) had half soles cut out for shoes +s bought 16 1/4 lbs soleather at 6 1/2 lbs of Hizer at 6/ + 10/6 Went to church Rev Mr Preston preached he came home with us for Dinner, Opened barrel Flour. Hauled C. B. 2 Loads Wood

div3.head: Saturday 18th
div3.p: Went to church went to Staunton in evening

div3.head: Sunday 19th
div3.p: Went to Church Mr. Preston preached Mr Martin Preached in evening at Churchville

div3.head: Monday 20th
div3.p: Sowed Wheat for Sellers they Borrowed 4 bus seed wheat shucked corn this evening

div3.head: Tuesday 21st
div3.p: Mr. Martin started home, Mrs. Shaver + Daughters came here made fence around hay stack

div3.head: Wednesday 22nd
div3.p: Picking Apples +c

div3.head: Thursday 23rd
div3.p: Sowed 2 bus Wheat in orchard plowed it in both ways with double shovel.

div3.head: Friday 24th Oct
div3.p: Sowed Wheat in sweet potatoe patch 1 bus

div3.head: Saturday 25th
div3.p: Sowed 1 bus Wheat in newground made Cider for Vinegar brought 2 barrels of flour from mill

div3.head: Sunday 26th
div3.p: Rained last night rained all day Mr. Walker preached at Churchville

div3.head: Monday 27-
div3.p: Still raining this morning cleared off about 4 Oclock started a plow,

div3.head: Tuesday 28th
div3.p: Plowing +c

div3.head: Wednesday 29th
div3.p: Plowing shuckin corn +c

div3.head: Thursday 30t
div3.p: Three of Sniders boys helping to shuck corn

div3.head: Friday 31st
div3.p: Very pretty weather got plow paint of Mr. Hotchkiss. Dennis returned home with 1500 lbs salt sent half of it to Capt Sterrett

div3.head: Saturday November 1s
div3.p: Took apples to Staunton sold for 151- bus deposited 30 Dollars in Bank

div3.head: Sunday 2n Nov
div3.p: Went to Church

div3.head: Monday 3d
div3.p: Notified to be in Staunton to serve in a jury, jury was made up before I got their, Deposited 20 Dollars in bank, Sniders 3 boys shuck corn

div3.head: Tuesday 4th
div3.p: Sniders boys shucking corn + brought back sheep

div3.head: Wednesday 5th
div3.p: Planted onions

div3.head: Thursday 6th
div3.p: Divided Salt with Capt Sterrett Sowed Wheat after Dinner

div3.head: Friday 7th
div3.p: Finished Drilling Wheat sowed 8 1/2 bus very cold wind from the north quite dry cant plow any more until it rains, Hauled C B 4 Loads wood (cold)

div3.head: Saturday 8
div3.p: put away Cabbage Hauled Ashes on Wheat in Orchard

div3.head: Sunday 9th
div3.p: Went to church Churchville Cold

div3.head: Monday 10th
div3.p: Choped Wood Sniders boys helping hauled Mrs. Knowles 1 Load 4 to Mr , bought 1 pr steers of

div3.head: Tuesday 11th Nov
div3.p: Chopping Wood Mr Sniders boys helped haul 1 Load + Mr Ewell 4

div3.head: Wednesday 12th
div3.p: Killed 6 hogs very pretty day Mr. Ewell + family came to see us

div3.head: Thursday 13
div3.p: Went to Sale of Mr. property

div3.head: Friday 14
div3.p: Salted pork . Ervine returned home hauled Mr. Lindsey 1 Load Wood Shucking corn The Farmers Club met at Mr. Rondabushes adjourned to meet at Mr. S. C. Wilsons or my house on the second Wednesday of Decr 5 1/2 Oclock

div3.head: Saturday 15
div3.p: Found my stray calf at Mr. G. Baylors brought it home

div3.head: Sunday 16th
div3.p: Went to church Churchville

div3.head: Monday 17th
div3.p: Hauled Mr. Biby one Load Wood paid Jerry John 100 Dollar for one yoke steers

div3.head: Tuesday 18th
div3.p: Sold Mr Trimble 4 Steers + one cow for 270 Dollars. bought a yoke of steers of Jerry Johns paid 150 Dollars

div3.head: Wednesday 19th Nov
div3.p: Delivered cattle to Tremble Thrashed Oats (Fran Coult)

div3.head: Thursday 20
div3.p: put away Oats had 60 bus put away 43 bus for seed

div3.head: Friday 21st
div3.p: put 25 Flour Barrels in Rennolds Mill Gathering Corn

div3.head: Saturday 22n
div3.p: Went to Mountain for pine got a very good Load

div3.head: Sunday 23d
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 24th
div3.p: Gathering corn

div3.head: Tuesday 25th Nov
div3.p: Sowed 3 bus Rye on cornground harrowed it in it had been sowed in Sept, but the dry weather caused it not to come,

div3.head: Wednesday 26th
div3.p: Hauling Wood

div3.head: Thursday 27th
div3.p: Butchered 13 hogs

div3.head: Friday 28th
div3.p: salted pork

div3.head: Saturday 29th
div3.p: Plowed garding

div3.head: Sunday 30th
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: December 1st Monday
div3.p: Hauling fodder Hardin helped Mr. Sellers to butcher

div3.head: Tuesday 2nd
div3.p: finished hauling Fodder out of one field Hauled C. B. 1 four horse Load Wood hauled Mr Biby's two horse Load.

div3.head: Wednesday 3rd
div3.p: Went to Funeral G. A. Wilsons child Dennis Hauled Mr. Stover one load pine from Mr. Shaver's,

div3.head: Thursday 4
div3.p: Chopping + Hauling Wood

div3.head: Friday 5
div3.p: Hauled C. b. 2 Loads Wood Snowed.

div3.head: Saturday 6th
div3.p: Went to the funeral of Jacob Hangers child boys cut Wood on wood pile

div3.head: Sunday 7th
div3.p: Went to church at Churchville

div3.head: Monday 8th
div3.p: put out stove chopping Wood +c

div3.head: Tuesday 9th
div3.p: In company went down to Mr. Rondabush to look over his farm that we might report at our next Club meeting Hauled coal for Mr Everett Hauled Mr Biby Loads Wood 2 horse

div3.head: Wednesday Decr 10th
div3.p: Hauling Coal for Mr Everett (2 Days)

div3.head: Thursday 11th
div3.p: Club met at my House, Mr. Jno Sellers paid me 22 Dollars for Vicks pine, Mr. Jno Trimble paid me 270 Dollars for Cattle, Sent my wagon above Middlebrook for corn for Mr. Lickleter, Election held to day for Delegate to Legislature,

div3.head: Friday 12th
div3.p: Had hands + shuck corn in barn

div3.head: Saturday 13th
div3.p: put corn in crib Wagon returned gone 2 1/2 Days Mrs Johns pd $32.24 for Lindsey Wilson +

div3.head: Sunday Decr 14th
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 15th
div3.p: Thrashed clover seed H Ervine stayed all night with us last night on his way home

div3.head: Tuesday 16h
div3.p: Finished thrashing clover seed had about 2 bus rained last night started a plow after Dinner paid Jno H. Bear $205.75 + took in my check for that amount which I have him some time since, Mr. Everett paid me $127.55 the Amt of his note.

div3.head: Wednesday Decr 17th
div3.p: Went to Staunton Mr. Lickleter paid me $15.75 - . Deposited $200. In Bant Cash in hand $67.35

div3.head: Thursday 18th
div3.p: Choping +c

div3.head: Friday 19th
div3.p: Sent for Jas H + Robert Jacob Hanger went, finished plowing

div3.head: Saturday 20t
div3.p: Children return from school, Hauling wood,

div3.head: Sunday 21st
div3.p: Went to church Churchville

div3.head: Monday 22nd
div3.p: Butchered 9 hogs sold 843 lbs to Dr Donaghe at 25

div3.head: Tuesday 23
div3.p: Delivered pork Sold 6 Barrels flour @ 14$ 36 1/2 lbs Bacon 31-amount received for pork +c $311.75 bought Rebecca's Bonnet home paid Mrs Stephens $11. For repairing bonnets

div3.head: Wednesday 24th
div3.p: Joshua chopping Wood Harden Hauling Sowed 1 1/2 bus Rye Hauled Mr Thomas 1 Load Fodder $10.

div3.head: Thursday 25th
div3.p: Christmas Dennis + Hardin Hauling Wood for themselves

div3.head: Friday 26
div3.p: Hauled CB 4 Load Wood I went to church

div3.head: Saturday 27
div3.p: I went to church Dennis + Harden take Holiday

div3.head: Sunday 28
div3.p: Went to church Sacrament administered

div3.head: Monday 29th
div3.p: Hauled 4 Loads Wood to Mrs Taylor 1 to Rev. Mr. Arnold I went to P Burkholders he was from home Mr. B. was from home

div3.head: Tuesday 30th
div3.p: Returned home

div3.head: Wednesday 31st
div3.p: Hauled Wood 2 Loads to Mr. Stover 2 to Mr. Biby 1 to Mr. Arnold

div3.head: January 1st 1863
div3.p: Went to Staunton Sold Hardin for 1950.00 I left the check with Capt Peck for amt found a blanket on my way home Mr. Teaford paid me 124$ Uncle Abrams board

div3.head: Jan 2d
div3.p: Splitting wood on clearning + Hauling Mrs Walker + Miss Martha all night with us went to Loch Willow to exhibition

div3.head: Jan 3d
div3.p: Saturday Boys have holiday

div3.head: Sunday 4
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 5t
div3.p: Splitting + Hauling

div3.head: Tuesday 6 7
div3.p: working on clearning

div3.head: Thursday 8
div3.p: Club met at Mr. J. Wilsons had a pleasant time next meeting at Mr. Geedings cutting stalks Mrs. Gooch at my house

div3.head: Friday
div3.p: working on clearing, sent wheat to mill

div3.head: Saturday 10th
div3.p: Working in clearning +c

div3.head: Sunday 11th
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 12th
div3.p: Hauled cord Wood for Mr. Lindsey, Hauled fodder.

div3.head: Tuesday 13
div3.p: Finished Hauling fodder commenced Hauling tan bark to Mr. Heizer's
Finished Hauling Bark had 9 cord at $20 pr Cord to be pd in Leather at $1.50 pr sole + $2.00 for upper

div3.head: Saturday 17th
div3.p: Working in clearing. Laid up with Rheumatism paid Mr Ziegler $100 for W. + B. Owe Z 79 cts

div3.head: Sunday 18
div3.p: still laid up

div3.head: Monday 19th
div3.p: Hauling Ice in Mr. Lindseys House

div3.head: Tuesday 20th
div3.p: boys working on clearing Miss Seigs + Mrs Hotchkiss here commenced snowing in eveing Mrs H Stayed all night

div3.head: Wednesday 21st
div3.p: Snowed all night 15 in deep wet + heavy, warm.

div3.head: Jan 22nd Thursday
div3.p: Snow melting slowly Dennis + Jas Henry Thrashing Rye with Flails Fannie took shirt to Mrs Cousin's to make.

div3.head: Friday 23rd
div3.p: Still warm Recd Coffee of Mr Lindsey finnished thrashing had bus Rye still housed up with Rheumatism, (better)

div3.head: Saturday 24t
div3.p: Hauled wood 2 Loads to C. b. 1 to Mrs Fisher 1 to Gregory Hauled some straw to Mr. Lindsey sold Mr. Gregory 29 lbs Bacon he still owes me 60

div3.head: Sunday 25th
div3.p: laid up still with Reumatism

div3.head: Jan 26th Monday
div3.p: boys working in clearning Willie Bear here

div3.head: Tuesday 27
div3.p: Sent doller with Willie to Mr. Ervine raining in morning. Settled with mr. Judson, owes me 68 lbs flour boys in clearning

div3.head: Wednesday 28th
div3.p: Snowing all day

div3.head: Thursday 29t
div3.p: Killed Beef made a broom Dennis sprained his ankle

div3.head: Friday 30t
div3.p: Nothing doing

div3.head: Saturday 31st
div3.p: Cut up beef + sold Mr. Gregory 1 Barrel Flour 14 Dollars to 30 lbs Beef 15.

div3.head: Feb 1st Sunday
div3.p: Went to church Mr. Walker preached at churchville in evening

div3.head: Monday 2nd
div3.p: Dennis helped Dr. Wilson to thrash

div3.head: Tuesday 3
div3.p: Dennis helped Dr to thrash Jas Henry took plow point pattern to Harrisonburg

div3.head: Wednesday 4th
div3.p: Hauled Jno. Powers 1 Load Wood Mr. Biby 1 Load Mr Taylor 1 Load Do Cousins 1 Load

div3.head: Thursday 5th
div3.p: Snowed all day

div3.head: Friday 6t Feb
div3.p: Hauling Manure or Wheat

div3.head: Saturday 7th
div3.p: Hauling manure bought Plank from saw mill sent 6 Flour Barrels to Trinity to mills. recd of Mr. Gregory let him have 14 1/2 lbs Bacon

div3.head: Sunday 8t
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 9t
div3.p: Hauled cord Wood for Mr. Lindsey 1 Load to Mr. Stover. Settled with Mrs. Hotchkiss they fell in my debt 26 10

div3.head: Tuesday 10th
div3.p: Went to Hotchkiss sale talked with Capt Sterret about settling the I left it to J. G. Stover + H. B. Sieg to set the price on horse + wagon they set the price at 60 cts per day for both

div3.head: Wednesday 11th
div3.p: Boys choping rained after noon

div3.head: Thursday 12th
div3.p: Went to Club meeting met at Mr. Geedings Hauled 5 Loads Wood to Rev Arnold Capt Hottle called a while in eveing Andrew Ervince her for the night Mr. Hotchkiss called Mr. Snider + 2 boys here choping

div3.head: Friday 13th
div3.p: Commenced plowing Snider + Boys here choping Started 2 plows too wet

div3.head: Saturday 14t Feb
div3.p: Plowing settled with Mr. Biby Sent calf Skill to Swope

div3.head: Sunday 15
div3.p: Went to church

div3.head: Monday 16th
div3.p: Carried Carriage spring to Capt Polmer to mend settled with him, got a plow point of Mr. Hotchkiss (hill side) bt two collars of Mr. Biby for 6$

div3.head: Tuesday 17t
div3.p: Snowing all day sent 3 single trees to Mr. Everett + chains to mend

div3.head: Wednesday 18th
div3.p: Hauling manure part of day rained all day

div3.head: Thursday 19t
div3.p: Hauled manure on meadow brot 6 Barrels Flour from mill let plank from mill bought 47 ft lumber from Lickleder for Hanover

div3.head: Friday 20 Feb
div3.p: Hauled 1/2 Day for Mrs Hotchkiss. Sled of Potatoe patch, was up at Mr. Swopes tan yard Rev Mr. Arnold paid his of $13.25 Mr. Biby repaired collar for carriage harness

div3.head: Feb 21st
div3.p: Huling Manure, went to Mr Evenes Fannie + Frank along. comemnced Snowing about dark snowed all night,

div3.head: Sunday 22
div3.p: Snowed nearly all day,

div3.head: Monday 23
div3.p: Started home left carriage very bad riding,

div3.head: Tuesday 24
div3.p: Haled out Straw stack boys hauled hay stack in yesterday

div3.head: Wednesday 25
div3.p: Hauling manure on cornground

div3.head: Thursday 26th
div3.p: Rained all day had stove doon mended Settle diwht C. B. pd him 20$

div3.head: Friday 27
div3.p: hauled wood to churchville 2 Load to Mrs Taylor 2 to Biby,

div3.head: Saturday 28th
div3.p: Hauled 2 Loads to Mrs Taylor 1 to Biby 2 to Powers + 1 to Mr. Arnold I went to Mr H. Sale no sale, made Hot bed in evening

div3.head: Sunday March 1st
div3.p: went to church churchville. Mrs Taylors smoke house burnt down Last night

div3.head: March 2nd Monday
div3.p: Plowing. Sent Mrs Taylor a piece Bacon

div3.head: Tuesday 3rd
div3.p: Recd of Mrs. Knowles 4$ Plowing had a very heavy snow storm which lasted about 15 minutes,

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: Plowing very cold considerable cold + snow +c very little plowing dun

div3.head: 13th Friday
div3.p: F Club met at Dr Wilsons. I was elected Secretary next meeting at Rob. Chochrans

div3.head: Thursday 19t
div3.p: Sowed Barley + some Oats snowed before I got it harrowed in Conference of the M. Church met at Churchville M. South + May Ball staying with us
sowed clover seed this morning + Orchard Grass in field back Orchard

div3.head: Wednesday 25th
div3.p: rained last night water high sent Preachers to Staunton by the Bredger

div3.head: 26t
div3.p: Plowing

div3.head: Friday 27t
div3.p: went to church, went to Henry's. brought upper Leather from Mr. Hizers, Mr. Ervince here on his way to Mr. Hustons.

div3.head: (28t)
div3.p: rained nearly all day. took Leather to Mr. Smith,

div3.head: Sunday 29t
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: (Monday 30t)
div3.p: went to Staunton Sent barrel Apples to Richmond to Tyler + Son to sell, bought 50 peach trees 6 Apple of Mr Davis

div3.head: (Tuesday 31)
div3.p: Snowed nearly all day took Leather to Mr. Smith Settled with him paid him $17 00 have a young Lamb

div3.head: Wednes April 1st 63
div3.p: Plowing

div3.head: (Thursday 2)
div3.p: plowing plowed potatoe patch,
Setting out fruit Trees planted potates on Friday in garden Sowed cabbage seed. Finished setting out trees today

div3.head: Sunday 5
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 6
div3.p: Sowing Oats finished plowing for Oats + Sowing Oats on Friday

div3.head: 10t
div3.p: Planted potatoes

div3.head: Sunday 12th
div3.p: went to church

div3.head: Monday 13th
div3.p: finished sowing clover seed

div3.head: Tuesday 14t
div3.p: Huled Hay stack

div3.head: Wednesday 15th
div3.p: Went to Staunton Deposited 280 Dollars in bank got 9 plow shears of Mr Eubanks

div3.head: Saturday 18th
div3.p: Dovoded Sweet potatoes,

div3.head: Tuesday 21st
div3.p: went to Staunton Deposited 1100 $ with agent for Coupon bonds drew out of Bank 775 Dollars

div3.head: Wednesday 22nd
div3.p: Sorrel mare has made a mule coult cow has a calf covered Grainery

div3.head: Thursday 23rd
div3.p: Raining cliped 11 head sheep washed wool same day hailed considerable

div3.head: Wednesday 29
div3.p: finished cliping sheep 11 head washed wool same day

div3.head: Friday 30
div3.p: Rone mare has a coult Took 4 Sorrel mares to Jack commenced planting corn on 28 Apl, Sent Fan to

div3.head: 11th
div3.p: Finished planting the two Fields

div3.head: Thursday 14th
div3.p: Club met at Capt Gundersins adjourned to meet at Jas Wilson Esqr.

div3.head: 20th
div3.p: planted potatoes

div3.head: Thursday 21st
div3.p: planting corn in newground

div3.head: Wednes May 27
div3.p: Had coalts operated on by Mr. Holler paid three Dollar a piece

div3.head: 29t
div3.p: borrowed 90 Dollars of Mr. Lindsey started with Mr. Trimble to Wood stock for a cane mill

div3.head: 30t
div3.p: Sold Mr. Donalsen + bargained for a mill. Returned home + arrived

div3.head: June 2nd
div3.p: Planted Pumkin seed + weighed wool 83 lb 8 1/4 lb for government

div3.head: Saturday 6th
div3.p: Went to Staunton.

div3.head: Monday 15th
div3.p: Met at Churchville to divide cotton finished Wednesday

div3.head: Tuesday 16th
div3.p: went to Staunton Deposited 700 $ for registered bond

div3.head: Thursday 11t
div3.p: Club met at James Wilsons. adjourned to meet at H. B. Seigs 2d Thursday in June

div3.head: Saturday 13t
div3.p: Distributed cotton

div3.head: Monday 15t
div3.p: coloured wool +c

div3.head: Wednesday 16t
div3.p: took 5 head cattle to Mountin. left them on top at grasy place

div3.head: Friday 19
div3.p: went to see Mr Bradon in gap
Mowed Hauled in some very dry no rain Since 15th May

div3.head: Friday 26
div3.p: commenced Raining

div3.head: Saturday 4t
div3.p: Rained nearly all day

div3.head: Monday 6th
div3.p: Set out Potatoe plants sold Mr.

div3.head: Tuesday 7th
div3.p: Commenced Harvesting rained nearly all day
